title: Python Programming Language
summary: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language created by Guido van Rossum in 1991. It emphasizes code readability through the use of significant indentation and supports multiple programming paradigms, including procedural, object-oriented, and functional programming. Pythonâ€™s dynamic typing and vast standard library have contributed to its popularity in data science, web development, automation, and AI.
